page.title: 02THE VILLAGE
page.content: Blennerhasset is a small village in Cumbria. It has a population of about 150. Most of the houses are set around the village green. Many of them are very old, dating back to the 15th. century. Some of them were originally farm buildings which have been converted. Also facing the green are the shop and the school. The shop was founded in 1867 by William Lawson of Brayton. The school was built about the same time and was originally an elementary school, with three rooms, for infants, juniors and seniors. Now there are only 24 children aged from 4 to 11. On the village green there is a war memorial dedicated to the men who died in the two wars.There are also some large trees including a horse-chestnut planted a hundred years ago. .
